meanings.definition: To sway or lurch while in motion
meanings.sent1: The boat started to careen from side to side as the waves grew stronger.
meanings.sent2: The car began to careen down the steep hill, making the passengers feel dizzy.
meanings.sent3: The penguin tried to careen gracefully on the ice but ended up slipping comically.
meanings.sent4: His emotions careened wildly, like a rollercoaster without brakes.
meanings.sent5: The careening ship painted a vivid picture of the power of the storm at sea.

meanings.sent1: The skateboarder decided to careen down the hill at full speed, risking a fall.
meanings.sent2: The reckless driver continued to careen through traffic, endangering others on the road.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel careened through the trees, knocking acorns down in its haste.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts careened like a runaway train, unable to stop or slow down.
meanings.sent5: The careening cyclist narrowly avoided a collision with a pedestrian.

meanings.definition: A sudden shift in direction or movement
meanings.sent1: The unexpected careen of the car took everyone by surprise, causing a gasp.
meanings.sent2: The careen of the ball off the wall changed the course of the game.
meanings.sent3: The careen of the shopping cart down the aisle startled the shoppers.
meanings.sent4: The careen of the plot in the movie kept the audience on the edge of their seats.
meanings.sent5: The careen of the comet across the night sky left a trail of wonder in its wake.
